lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Write a React component that conditionally renders a greeting based on a prop value.

Make sure to type ?.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will be displayed if the following component is rendered with isVisible set to false?

An empty pageA header elementAn error will occurVisible Content is hidden

An empty page.

lessons.title: Lesson #1
lessons.interactiveContent:
Use conditional rendering to display a message when the countdown timer is less than 10 seconds.

Make sure to pick time followed by < and then 10, &&.

lessons.title: Lesson #2
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this React component display when the button is clicked?

Here are the important detailsDetails remain hidden and button reads Hide DetailsA warning message appearsNothing is displayed

Here are the important details.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Key props are important in React lists. Add the key to each item in a list of superheroes.

Make sure to type key.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Why must we use a key prop with React Fragments when they are used in lists?

To help React identify which items have changedTo apply CSS stylingTo increase rendering speedTo prevent memory leaks

To help React identify which items have changed.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Render a custom message only when a prize is not yet set, using the OR operator.

Make sure to type ||.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
What will be displayed if the isAdmin is true in this code?

Access grantedAccess deniedIt will display both messagesNo content will be displayed

Access granted.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a React component that toggles a message when clicking a button. Use state to manage the visibility of the message.

Make sure to pick visible followed by setVisible and then setVisible, !visible.

lessons.title: Lesson #4
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which of the following describes the function of a conditional rendering in React?

It decides if a component should render or not based on certain conditionsIt acts like a global state managerIt allows for faster rendering of components by caching themIt manages component lifecycles efficiently

It decides if a component should render or not based on certain conditions.

lessons.title: Lesson #3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement a React component to show a message when the scores are tied.

Make sure to pick {, followed by &&, and finally }.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Complete the code to use the full <React.Fragment> syntax.

Make sure to type React.Fragment.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which attributes are not allowed in React Fragments?

className and stylekeyid and hrefdata-* attributes

className and style.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Implement a React component that displays stock status based on availability with conditional rendering.

Make sure to pick { followed by props.inStock and then ?, <p>In Stock!</p>, :, <p>Out of Stock!</p>, }.

lessons.title: Lesson #7
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which operator can be used to render content on the left side if it evaluates to false, otherwise render the content on the right side?

Logical OR || operatorLogical AND && operatorTernary ?: operatorEquality === operator

Logical OR || operator.

lessons.title: Lesson #8
lessons.interactiveContent:
Display a secret message only when the user role is an admin using a ternary operator.

Make sure to pick role followed by === and then "admin", ?, :.

lessons.title: Lesson #5
lessons.interactiveContent:
Create a welcome message based on user authentication using conditional rendering.

Make sure to pick isAuthenticated followed by false and then isAuthenticated, ?, :.

lessons.title: Lesson #6
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which message will show if isFeatureEnabled is false?

Feature coming soonNew feature is liveNo content will be displayedIt will display both messages

Feature coming soon.
